reg.title: Hotel Room Tax Regulation for the District of Squamish
reg.amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 196/2011, November 21, 2011]

section.sectiontext: In this regulation, Act means the Hotel Room Tax Act.
October 31, 2009, is the prescribed date after which section 3 of the Act applies in respect of accommodation purchased in the District of Squamish.
The tax payable under section 3 (1) of the Act is 2% of the purchase price of accommodation purchased in the District of Squamish.

section.marginalnote: Prescribed purpose for expenditure of tax
section.sectiontext: The District of Squamish may spend the amount paid to it out of the revenue collected from the tax for tourism marketing, programs and projects.
This regulation is repealed effective November 1, 2014.

footnote.footnotetext: See section 45 of the Provincial Sales Tax Transitional Provisions and Amendments Act, 2013, S.B.C. 2013, c. 1
